history.proof: intros Hvalid Hfind Hneq Hmsgspec. unfold consume_msg. rewrite Hfind. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)) pt : nat_eqType from : nat to : nid to' : nat tg : nat_eqType cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType i : mid m : TaggedMessage Hvalid : valid s Hfind : find i s = Some {| content := m; from := from; to := to'; active := true |} Hneq : pt != from Hmsgspec : msg_spec pt to tg cnt s Unable to unify "msg_spec pt to tg cnt s" with "msg_spec pt to tg cnt (upd i (mark_msg {| content := m; from := from; to := to'; active := true |}) s)".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
s: PCM.sort (union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)))
pt: Equality.sort nat_eqType
from: nat
to: nid
to': nat
tg: Equality.sort nat_eqType
cnt: Equality.sort (seq_eqType nat_eqType)
i: Ordered.sort mid
m: TaggedMessage

Goal:
valid s -> find i s = Some {| content := m; from := from; to := to'; active := true |} -> pt != from -> msg_spec pt to tg cnt s -> msg_spec pt to tg cnt (consume_msg s i)

Premises:
union_map_classPCM : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type), union_map_class K V -> pcm
Record msg (mtype : Type) : Type := Msg { content : mtype; from : nat; to : nat; active : bool } Arguments msg _%type_scope Arguments Msg [mtype]%type_scope _ (_ _)%nat_scope _%bool_scope
Inductive bool : Set := true : bool | false : bool
find : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type) (cT : union_map_class K V), K -> cT -> option V
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
consume_msg = fun (s : soup) (id : mid) => match find id s with | Some m => upd id (mark_msg m) s | None => s end : soup -> mid -> soup
nid = nat : Set
msg_spec = fun (from to : nid) (tg : nat_eqType) (cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType) => msg_in_soup from to (fun (x : nat) (y : seq nat) => (x == tg) && (y == cnt)) : nid -> nid -> nat_eqType -> seq_eqType nat_eqType -> soup -> Prop
nat_eqType = EqType nat nat_eqMixin : eqType
Inductive option (A : Type) : Type := Some : A -> option A | None : option A Arguments option _%type_scope Arguments Some {A}%type_scope a : rename Arguments None {A}%type_scope
content : forall mtype : Type, msg mtype -> mtype
Record TaggedMessage : Set := TMsg { tag : nat; tms_cont : seq nat } Arguments TMsg _%nat_scope _%seq_scope
active : forall mtype : Type, msg mtype -> bool
sort : forall T : Type, rel T -> seq T -> seq T
Notation valid := @PCM.valid
union_mapUMC : forall (K : ordType) (V : Type), union_map_class K V
mid = [ordType of nat] : ordType
seq_eqType = fun T : eqType => EqType (seq T) (seq_eqMixin T) : eqType -> eqType
msg_specE_consume : forall (s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage))) (pt : nat_eqType) (from : nat) (to : nat_eqType) (to' : nat) (tg : nat_eqType) (cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType) (i : mid) (m : TaggedMessage), valid s -> find i s = Some {| content := m; from := from; to := to'; active := true |} -> (pt != from) || (to != to') -> msg_spec pt to tg cnt s -> msg_spec pt to tg cnt (consume_msg s i)
msg_spec_consume : forall (s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage))) (from to tg : nat) (cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType) (cnt' : seq nat) (i : mid), valid s -> find i s = Some {| content := {| tag := tg; tms_cont := cnt' |}; from := from; to := to; active := true |} -> msg_spec from to tg cnt s -> no_msg_from_to from to (consume_msg s i)
no_msg_from_consume : forall (from : nid) (from' to : nat) (s : union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)) (i : mid) (m : TaggedMessage), find i s = Some {| content := m; from := from'; to := to; active := true |} -> valid s -> no_msg_from from s -> no_msg_from from (consume_msg s i)
no_msg_from_post : forall (from from' to : nid) (s : soup) (tms : TaggedMessage), valid s -> no_msg_from from s -> from' != from -> no_msg_from from (post_msg s {| content := tms; from := from'; to := to; active := true |}).1
flattenP : reflect (exists2 s0 : seq_eqType ?T, s0 \in ?A & ?x \in s0) (?x \in flatten ?A) where ?T : [s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)) pt : nat_eqType from : nat to : nid to' : nat tg : nat_eqType cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType i : mid m : TaggedMessage |- eqType] ?A : [s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)) pt : nat_eqType from : nat to : nid to' : nat tg : nat_eqType cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType i : mid m : TaggedMessage |- seq (seq ?T)] ?x : [s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)) pt : nat_eqType from : nat to : nid to' : nat tg : nat_eqType cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType i : mid m : TaggedMessage |- Equality.sort ?T]
vrefl_rect : forall x : ?T, ?P x -> x = x where ?T : [s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)) pt : nat_eqType from : nat to : nid to' : nat tg : nat_eqType cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType i : mid m : TaggedMessage |- Type] ?P : [s : union_map_classPCM (union_mapUMC mid (msg TaggedMessage)) pt : nat_eqType from : nat to : nid to' : nat tg : nat_eqType cnt : seq_eqType nat_eqType i : mid m : TaggedMessage |- pred ?T]
